poem:
**Silence in Muskogee**

In the hush of dust-worn rooms, shadows  
spill secrets we've no right to bear. Echoes  
of childhood unheld, innocence halted,  
the silent scream of a future stolen.  
  
In this quiet collapse,  
a community bows its head,  
yet even the soil whispers  
what the tongue won't dare.
